subSections.title: Alternative forms
subSections.text: * In {{w|traditional Chinese}} (based on the character form used in {{w|zh:國字標準字體|Taiwan}}), the [[述#Translingual|述]] component under the grass radical contains {{l|mul|朮}}. * In mainland China (based on the {{w|Xin Zixing}} {{w2|zh|新字形}} standardized character form), the [[述#Translingual|述]] component under the grass radical contains {{l|mul|术}} instead. * In Japanese {{w|kanji}}, this character is encoded with a slightly different form. The component {{l|mul|术}} is written under the grass radical, giving the form of [[𦬸#Translingual|𦬸]] which is enclosed by [[辶#Translingual|辶]] as its bottom left component. * A separate character, {{l|mul|𦳯}} (U+26CEF) exists for a {{w|Variant Chinese character|variant form}} found in the historical Chinese dictionary {{w|Jiyun}} 《{{w2|zh|集韻}}》 which is similar to its Japanese form.

subSections.title: Usage notes
subSections.text:
Although the basic components of the character is the same, the components have different stroke counts:
* In traditional Chinese: <font size=5, lang=zh-hant>[[艹#Translingual|艹]]</font> (4 strokes) + <font size=5, lang=zh-hant>[[辶#Translingual|辶]]</font> (4 strokes) +  {{l|mul|朮}} (5 strokes) - Total: 13 strokes
* In mainland China: <font size=5, lang=zh-hans>[[艹#Translingual|艹]]</font> (3 strokes) + <font size=5, lang=zh-hans>[[辶#Translingual|辶]]</font> (3 strokes) + <font size=5, lang=zh-hans>{{l|mul|术}}</font> (5 strokes) - Total: 11 strokes
* In Japanese: <font size=5, lang=ja>[[艹#Translingual|艹]]</font> (3 strokes) + <font size=5, lang=ja>[[辶#Translingual|辶]]</font> (4 strokes)<!-- Note: Non Jōyō kanji counted as 4 strokes --> + <font size=5, lang=zh-hans>{{l|mul|术}}</font> (5 strokes) - Total: 12 strokes
